intro: Platystemon villosus, commonly known as the hairy platystemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
